Title: Entity Framework - improve query performance - potential problems
Description: This the first post from series where I am going to describe ways to create more performant queries using an Entity Framework 6.

Title: Entity Framework - Contains() on empty collection.
Description: SQL query that is generated when you make a contains on an empty collection

Title: Entity Framework - the query plan cache story
Description: Investigation of performance issues in an application with Entity Framework as data access technology.

Title: Entity Framework 6.2 Runtime Released
Description: Entity Framework (EF) is Microsoft's traditional object/relational mapper (O/RM) for .NET Framework.

Title: Announcing Entity Framework Core 2.0
Description: Entity Framework (EF) Core is the lightweight, extensible, and cross-platform version of Entity Framework, the popular Object/Relational Mapping (O/RM) framework for .NET.

Title: Announcing EF Core 2.0 Preview 2
Description: EF Core follows the same release cycle as .NET Core but can be used in multiple .NET platforms, including .NET Core 2.0 and .NET Framework 4.6.1 or newer.

Title: Announcing EF 6.2 beta 1
Description: EF 6.2 is a new iteration of Microsoft's more traditional object/relational mapper for .NET Framework.

Title: Announcing EF Core 2.0 Preview 1
Description: EF Core follows the same release cycle as .NET Core but can be used in multiple .NET platforms, including .NET Core 2.0 and .NET Framework 4.6 or newer.

Title: Implementing Seeding, Custom Conventions and Interceptors in EF Core 1.0
Description: Entity Framework Core (EF Core) is a lightweight and extensible version of the Entity Framework (EF) data access technology which is cross-platform and supports multiple database providers.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (1) Remote Query
Description: This chapter discusses a different kind of LINQ technology, LINQ to Entities, which queries relational data managed by databases.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (2) Modeling Database: Object-Relational Mapping
Description: Object-relational mapping is a popular technology to map and convert between application data objects and database relational data.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (3) Logging and Tracing Queries
Description: To understand how EF/Core work with databases, it is important to uncover the actual underlying operations to the SQL database, which can be traced or logged in C# application side and in SQL database.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (4) Query Methods (Operators)
Description: This part discusses how to query SQL database with the defined mapping entities. In EF/Core, LINQ to Entities supports most of the methods provided by Queryable

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (5) Query Translation Implementation
Description: This part discusses how the translation is implemented. Regarding different database systems can have different query languages or different query APIs, EF/Core implement a provider model to work with different kinds of databases.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (6) Query Data Loading
Description: After translated to SQL, in LINQ to Entities, sequence queries returning IQueryable implements deferred execution too.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (7) Data Changes and Transactions
Description: Besides LINQ to Entities queries, EF/Core also provides rich APIs for data changes, with imperative paradigm.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (8) Optimistic Concurrency
Description: Conflicts can occur if the same data is read and changed concurrently. Generally, there are two concurrency control approaches, Pessimistic concurrency, and Optimistic concurrency.

Title: Entity Framework/Core and LINQ to Entities (9) Performance
Description: This part discusses some aspects that can impact the performance of EF/Core and LINQ to Entities,

Title: It's here! Trackable Entities for EF Core!
Description: Trackable Entities project track changes to an object graph as you update, add and remove items, then send those changes to a back-end service where they can be saved in a single transaction.

Title: EF 6.x Code-First and Model-First with Trackable Entities 2.1
Description: The advantage of the consolidated designer is that you can pick and choose which tables you want, versus generating classes for all the tables in your database

Title: Real-World MVVM with Entity Framework and ASP.NET Web API
Description: I just completed a sample application using Simple MVVM Toolkit together with Trackable Entities to build a real-world N-Tier solution with a WPF client and portable POCO entities that are automatically change-tracked and sent to an ASP.NET Web API service that uses Entity Framework to perform asynchronous CRUD operations.

Title: Become an N-Tier Ninja with Trackable Entities 2.0
Description: Taking a cue from Julie Lerman and Scott Hanselman, I've decided to dub version 2.0 of my Trackable Entities framework, the Ninja Edition.

Title: Trackable Entities - Now with Repository and Unit of Work
Description: With inquires on the project discussion forum, and some prompting by my friend Long Le, who authored the Generic Unit of Work and Repository Framework, I decided to add support to my framework for using Repository and Unit of Work design patterns.

Title: Trackable Entities versus Self-Tracking Entities
Description: In this blog post I'd like to perform an in-depth comparison between my own Trackable Entities framework and the now deprecated Self-Tracking Entities, written by the Entity Framework team at Microsoft.

Title: API Improvements in Trackable Entities v1.01
Description: I'd like to announce version 1.01 of Trackable Entities, which fixes a few issues and adds two methods to the API: AcceptChanges and MergeChanges

Title: Trackable Entities Version 1.0 Released!
Description: I am pleased to announce the release of Trackable Entities version 1.0 - with support for both WCF and ASP.NET Web API with Visual Studio 2012 and 2013!

Title: Trackable Entities: N-Tier Support for Entity Framework
Description: Writing N-Tier apps can get complicated fast. Consider the assortment of n-tier technologies now consigned to the ash heap of history: WCF RIA Services, Self-Tracking Entities, and good old typed DataSets.

Title: Webinar: N-Tier Entity Framework with DTOs
Description: I recently delivered a free webinar for DevelopMentor on n-tier application development using Entity Framework 4.0.

Title: Running Entity Framework (Core) commands in Rider
Description: How can we run Entity Framework commands like adding migrations or updating the database, in Rider?

Title: Webinar - When Hadi Met Julie: A Story of Entity Framework, ReSharper, a Spaniard and The Data Farm Queen
Description: When Hadi tried to create an Entity Framework app, he realized just how bad of a noob he really was (not surprising). He then decided to call on a favor to Julie, the Data Farm Queen.

Title: Telerik ASP.NET AJAX Controls and Entity Framework 6 - Buttery Smoothness
Description: Microsoft didn't provide support for the Entity Framework Data Source in ASP.NET when the updated Entity Framework 6 (EF6) framework released. In this article, Jeff Fritz shows you how Telerik is supporting the recently released EF6 support for ASP.NET web forms.

Title: Using Entity Framework with Telerik Reporting and Report Designer (OBSOLETE)
Description: This article outlines how to use newer versions of Entity Framework (EF) with Telerik Reporting as well as the stand-alone Telerik Report Designer.

Title: Connecting Telerik Reporting to SQL Azure via Entity Framework
Description: In this blog post from the series we discussed how to connect Telerik Reporting to a SQL Azure database using Open Access ORM with the OpenAccessDataSource component.

Title: Master-Details with RadGridView for Silverlight 4, WCF RIA Services RC2 and Entity Framework 4.0
Description: I have prepared a sample project with the Silverlight 4 version of RadGridView released yesterday. The sample project was created with Visual Studio 2010, WCF RIA Services RC 2 for Visual Studio 2010, and ADO.NET Entity Framework (.NET 4).

Title: Connecting the Dots: ADO.NET Data Services and Telerik Reporting
Description: ADO.NET Data Services (formerly Astoria) is one of the new technologies released as part of v3.5 SP1 of the .NET Framework. If you haven't tried this new addition to the framework, I highly suggest you give it a spin. It's very cool and allows you to quickly and easily set up RESTful WCF services with which your application can interact with the database.

Title: Two New RadTips Episodes: RadGrid, Entity Framework, and More!
Description: I'm happy to announce two new episode of RadTips, a series of screencasts offering tips and tricks for using Telerik's RadControls

Title: Verify Database Prior To Data Insertion Using EF
Description: This blogs talks about how to verify DB schema before doing insert operation via Entity Framework.

Title: Logging Database Operations To File In Entity Framework 6
Description: Here, you will learn how to log the database operation to files in Entity Framework 6

Title: How To Validate The Entity Framework Generated Database Connection String Before Starting An Application
Description: Here we going to discuss, how to validate the entity framework generated database connection string in c# before starting an application.

Title: Access Stored Procedure With User Defined Data Type Using Entity Framework
Description: Accessing table value type in Entity Framework

Title: Entity Vs Model Vs ViewModel Vs DataModel
Description: Different people define Entity, Model, ViewModel and DataModel in different ways. However, these terms may sometimes differ from their actual meaning, based upon the context.

Title: Colored Entities With EntityFramework
Description: In this blog, we are going to see how to apply the colors for the entities in an Entity Framework.

Title: Generic Repository Pattern With Web-API And Entity Framework
Description: Repository pattern represents Don't repeat yourself, So now, we will see how the code is avoided by repeating ourselves.

Title: Implement Database First Approach with Entity Framework
Description: In this blog, we going to learn about the database first approach. If we want to perform business operations with the existing database

Title: Code First Approach Using Entity Framework
Description: In this blog, you will learn about Code First Approach, using Entity Framework.

Title: Overview Of Entity Framework
Description: In this blog, you will learn about Entity Framework.

Title: Creating Web API Using Entity Framework With LINQ Query In MVC 4
Description: In this blog I am showing how to create Web API using Entity Framework with LINQ Query in .NET MVC 4.

Title: Many-to-many relationships in EF Core 2.0 - Part 4: A more general abstraction
Description: In the last few posts we saw how to hide use of the join entity from two entities with a many-to-many relationship. This post doesn't add any additional functionality, it just abstracts some of what we saw so it can be re-used more easily.

Title: Many-to-many relationships in EF Core 2.0 - Part 3: Hiding as ICollection
Description: In the previous post we ended up with entities that hide the join entity from the public surface. However, it was not possible to add or removed entities through this public surface. To enable this we need an ICollection implementation that acts as a true facade over the real join entity collection and delegates all responsibilities to that collection.

Title: Many-to-many relationships in EF Core 2.0 - Part 2: Hiding as IEnumerable
Description: In the previous post we looked at how many-to-many relationships can be mapped using a join entity. In this post we'll make the navigation properties to the join entity private so that they don't appear in the public surface of our entity types.

Title: Many-to-many relationships in EF Core 2.0 - Part 1: The basics
Description: As of EF Core 2.0, many-to-many relationships without an explicitly mapped join table are not supported. However, all is not lost.

Title: Add, Attach, Update, and Remove methods in EF Core 1.1
Description: EF Core provides a variety of ways to start tracking entities or change their state. This post gives a brief overview of the different approaches.

Title: EF Core 1.1: Looking at your model in the debugger
Description: As developers on the EF team it is often useful to see what is in the metadata model. To facilitate this, the model and all other metadata elements are able to generate a debug view which provides lots of useful information about the metadata in a terse but human-readable form.

Title: Notification entities in EF Core 1.1
Description: By default, EF Core uses snapshot change tracking. However, if entity types implement INotifyPropertyChanged and optionally INotifyPropertyChanging, then EF can use these notifications to avoid the overhead of creating snapshots and detecting changes.

Title: So you want to write an EF Core provider
Description: Writing a database provider for EF Core can be daunting. I have written several posts over the last month containing information you need to know when writing a provider. This post pulls all that together to give an overview of the different building blocks with links to previous posts containing the details.

Title: Implementing provider extension methods in EF Core 1.1
Description: This post showed the extension methods used by providers to add provider-specific functionality to EF. This post describes how to implement those methods. This post is aimed at provider writers or those who may want to contribute to the EF Core source code.

Title: Internal code in EF Core 1.1
Description: There is very little code in EF Core that is truely internal. Instead, code that would traditionally have been internal has been made public but documented as internal. This post looks at what this means for application developers and how you can use this code responsibly.

Title: EF Core 1.1 metadata overview
Description: This post provides a high-level overview of metadata structure and APIs in EF Core 1.1. It covers the core metadata interfaces and shows how they are extended with particular focus on provider extensions.

Title: Implementing a provider Use... method for EF Core 1.1
Description: The previous post contained lots of information about how dependency injection works with database providers. This post adds more to the provider story by explaining how to implement a method like UseSqlServer that allows applications to select the provider to use.

Title: EF Core Dependency Injection Internals
Description: A previous post gave an overview of how dependency injection is used internally by EF Core, and how applications might interact with this. In this post we will look at some of the internal details. This post is aimed at provider writers and people who may want to contribute to the EF source code.

Title: Collection navigation properties and fields in EF Core 1.1
Description: There has recently been some confusion about what mappings are supported for collection navigation properties in EF Core. This post is an attempt to clear things up.

Title: Dependency Injection in EF Core 1.1
Description: EF Core can interact with dependency injection in two ways: a container can be used to create DbContext instances and EF uses a D.I. container internally for its own services

Title: EF Core 1.1 - Creating DbContext instances
Description: This post describes the different ways to create and configure instances of DbContext in EF Core 1.1.

Title: EF7 Provider Building Blocks
Description: In this post I'll outline the basic building blocks needed for an EF7 provider. The idea is not to show how everything should be implemented, but rather to show what pieces are needed and how they fit together.

Title: EF 6.1: Creating indexes with IndexAttribute
Description: Since EF 4.3 it has been possible to use CreateIndex and DropIndex in Code First Migrations to create and drop indexes. However this had to be done manually by editing the migration because the index was not included anywhere in the Code First model.

Title: EF 6.1: Turning on logging without recompiling
Description: I already blogged about SQL logging in EF6. Part 3 of that series shows how to use EF with a logging framework such as NLog. If you do this then you can easily switch logging on and off using NLog or equivalent without any changes to the app.

Title: EF6 SQL Logging - Part 3: Interception building blocks
Description: In parts 1 and 2 of this series we looked at how to use DbContext.Database.Log to log the SQL generated by EF. But this code is actually a relatively thin facade over some low-level building blocks for interception in general and, in this case, DbCommand interception in particular.

Title: EF6 SQL Logging - Part 2: Changing the content/formatting
Description: In part 1 we saw how DbContext.Database.Log can be used to easily log SQL to the console or some other TextWriter. This post covers how the context and formatting of the output can be changed.

Title: EF6 SQL Logging - Part 1: Simple Logging
Description: On the EF team we made a late decision to add some support for interception and logging of generated SQL in EF6.

Title: EF6: Nested types and more for Code First
Description: Ever since POCO support was introduced in EF4 there have been two limiting restrictions on the types that can be mapped

Title: EF enums and spatial types on .NET 4
Description: In EF5 some features (such as enums and spatial types) are only available when targeting .NET 4.5. This is because EF5 relies on core EF libraries in the .NET Framework. With EF6 this changes because the core EF code is now included in EntityFramework.dll and recent commits to the code make all EF features (except async) available on .NET 4.

Title: EF6 Extensibility and Configuration
Description: The idea is that people who are interested in where EF is going can read posts like this and provide feedback on the direction, design, and implementation. Providing this kind of feedback is an important way to contribute to EF without even having to write any code.

Title: So you want to contribute to EF? Part 4: Developer experience
Description: This is the fourth part of a series providing some background to those who may want make contributes to the Entity Framework. In this post I'll talk a bit about maintaining a good experience for the developers who use EF.

Title: So you want to contribute to EF? Part 3: Testing
Description: This is the third part of a series providing some background to those who may want make contributes to the Entity Framework. This post will cover the types of tests that at exist and expectations around writing new tests.

Title: So you want to contribute to EF? Part 2: The code
Description: This is the second part of a series providing some background to those who may want make contributes to the Entity Framework. This post will cover the high-level organization of the code describing the assemblies created and some of the namespaces used.

Title: So you want to contribute to EF? Part 1: Introduction
Description: As you have probably heard the Entity Framework source code is now available under an open source license. This means that the EF team are ready and excited to take your contributions.

Title: Why open sourcing Entity Framework is a great move
Description: You have likely heard by now that the Entity Framework source code has been released under an open source license. I'm a developer on the EF team and I'd like to give you my perspective on this.

Title: Deleting orphans with Entity Framework
Description: A  required relationship means that the child cannot exist without a parent, and if the parent is deleted or the relationship between the child and the parent is severed, then the child becomes orphaned. In such situations it is often useful to have the orphaned child automatically deleted.

Title: The key to AddOrUpdate
Description: The DbSet.Find method provides an easy way to lookup an entity given its primary key. One place this can be useful is in an AddOrUpdate method when loading an entity which can then be updated with values from another application tier

Title: Code First model builder versions
Description: Code First's convention-based approach to building a model has some interesting implications for breaking changes between different versions of EF. This post describes those implications and shows how model builder versions can be used to deal with potential breaking changes while still retaining a forward-moving developer experience.

Title: Code First Building Blocks
Description: There are plenty of examples out there showing how to use DbContext to create a Code First model. But DbContext itself uses some fundamental Code First building blocks to do its stuff. This post shows how these building blocks can be used directly, which can be useful in situations where you need more control over how the model is created or cached.

Title: Code First Data Annotations on non-public properties
Description: The Entity Framework supports mapping to public, protected, internal, and private properties. However, there are a few restrictions when mapping to non-public properties. and there are also some things you need to know when attempting to configure such mappings using Code First.

Title: EF5: Rejecting changes to a single property
Description: There is one little feature you may not have heard about the ability to reject changes to an individual property. That is, to reset the IsModified flag of a property such that the value of that property will not be sent to the database.

Title: Secrets of DetectChanges Part 4: Binary properties and complex types
Description: In this post we're going to look at some corner cases around complex types and binary properties. While these are corner cases its still worth knowing about them so they don't catch you out if you ever run into them.

Title: Secrets of DetectChanges Part 3: Switching off automatic DetectChanges
Description: In this part we'll look at how automatic calls to DetectChanges can be switched off and what you then need to do differently in your code.

Title: Secrets of DetectChanges Part 2: When is DetectChanges called automatically?
Description: This part will expand on that information and look at when it is important for the context to know about these changes. This will provide the basis for detailing when the context calls DetectChanges automatically.

Title: Secrets of DetectChanges Part 1: What does DetectChanges do?
Description: Entity Framework change tracking is often something that doesn't require too much thought from the app developer. However, change tracking and the DetectChanges method are a part of the stack where there is a tension between ease-of-use and performance.

Title: Code First Migrations: Making __MigrationHistory not a system table
Description: Code First Migrations uses a table called __MigrationHistory as a place to store metadata about the migrations that have been applied to the database. Code First creates this table when it creates a database or when migrations are enabled.

Title: Don't use Code First by mistake
Description: EF Code First is great and I use it all the time, even when mapping to existing databases. However, if your intention is to use a Database First flow, then it's important that you don't start to use Code First unintentionally.

Title: Why Entity Framework is releasing on NuGet only
Description: EF 4.2 and 4.3 were released via NuGet only and there are no MSI installers. The up-coming EF 5.0 release will continue this pattern. But why NuGet and why only NuGet? It's not because NuGet is awesome, even though it is, or because it's the hot new thing, even though it is. It's because it is a great match for delivering the EF runtime.

Title: EF 4.3 Beta 1: What happened to that EdmMetadata table?
Description: EF 4.3 Beta1 integrates Code First Migrations into the EntityFramework NuGet package. Part of this integration means that databases created with Code First no longer include the EdmMetadata table. The databases are instead setup to work directly with Migrations making it easy to migrate the database in the future even if this need is not anticipated when the database is first created.

Title: What's the deal with mapping foreign keys using the Entity Framework?
Description: Since EF4 it has been possible to map foreign key columns to properties of entity classes. But is it really a good idea to do this? In this post I'll explain the reasons for keeping foreign keys out of your object model and contrast that with how mapping foreign keys may make your life easier.

Title: Should you use Entity Framework change-tracking proxies?
Description: So when should you use change-tracking proxies? To answer that let's take a closer look at the advantages and disadvantages of change-tracking proxies over other types of POCO entities.

Title: Entity types supported by the Entity Framework
Description: I was going to write a post about when to use change-tracking proxies. But I then thought before doing that it would be useful to go over all the different types of classes that the Entity Framework supports, of which change-tracking proxies is one.

Title: Why are the DbContext T4 templates so different from the EF4 POCO templates?
Description: The most obvious difference is that the DbContext templates use DbContext while the EF4 POCO templates use ObjectContext. But beyond that, the POCO templates have a lot of code that attempts to do fixup of properties and relationships even when the entity is not attached to the context. The DbContext templates have none of this code.

Title: EF 4.1 Quick Tip: Add/Attach Returns Your Entity
Description: We did a few things in EF 4.1 that were not at all ground-breaking or cool or anything like that, but were intended only to make programming a little bit more pleasant. One of those was making the Add and Attach methods return a reference to the added or attached entity.

Title: Code First: Inside DbContext Initialization
Description: A lot of stuff happens when you use a DbContext instance for the first time. Most of the time you don't worry about this stuff, but sometimes it's useful to know what's happening under the hood. And even if it's not useful, it's hopefully interesting for its geek value alone.

Title: LazyCountCollection with Better Performance
Description: In my previous two posts I showed how to implement an extra-lazy Count property using EF 4.1. However, the code required that a lot of .NET Reflection happen for every entity returned by a query. The real-world performance impact of this can vary greatly, but for an application that queries for a lot of entities it could be significant.

Title: Extra-Lazy Collection Count with EF 4.1 (Part 2)
Description: In part 1 we setup all the infrastructure for implementing an extra-lazy Count property with EF 4.1, now let's actually use it!

Title: Extra-Lazy Collection Count with EF 4.1 (Part 1)
Description: Lazy loading of collections is the process whereby a collection of entities is automatically loaded from the database the first time that the collection property referring to the entities is accessed.

Title: Confronting Your Entity Framework Performance Fears
Description: The most common thing I hear from developers that haven't worked with Entity Framework is that it performs slowly on large sets of data. Although I have heard this numerous times, in reality, it has never turned out to be an Entity Framework issue, but more of an education/adoption issue and simple coding style changes resolve the issues.

Title: Entity Framework Core & Complex Projects
Description: For those migrating to Entity Framework Core (EFCore) the online documentation is very helpful for the most basic of projects. However, as you work to create more complex applications, things can get more complicated.

Title: Using Entity Framework with Legacy Databases
Description: I have worked with many people that have thought we have a legacy database setup, we can't use entity framework or we cannot use migrations, so we can't use code first. Both are very common misconceptions, but something that isn't the case.

Title: Handing Namespace and Class Changes in Entity Framework
Description: Entity Framework is an amazing set of tooling that helps to manage data access in an efficient manner, however, it seems that when things start to go funny it can be a major time-suck.

Title: ASP.NET: Audit Trail Implementation using Entity Framework
Description: When you are working with certain projects which involves the Customer records, you might need to track of each and every addition/change made to system along with who create, modify and delete the records.

Title: Entity Framework CodeFirst Approach
Description: Entity Framework is an enhancement to an existing ADO.Net technique and ORM framework we used for Microsoft technologies.

Title: Entity Framework Code First
Description: In Code First approach, you avoid working with visual model designer (EDMX) completely. You write your POCO classes first and then create database from these POCO classes.

Title: Using Plan Explorer with Entity Framework
Description: Entity Framework, just like other ORMs, takes your application code and magically turns it into T-SQL. The problem, as any good DBA will tell you, is that the magic comes at a cost: you can end up with a query that doesn't perform well and is difficult to tune due to poor readability of the actual T-SQL code.

Title: Building Android Apps with Entity Framework
Description: Data is a big part of any application development and mobile apps are no exception; the way we handle data as developers is one of the many important decisions we must make for our mobile apps. From key-value stores to SQLite, there are many options available, but one that .NET developers are often especially familiar with is the Entity Framework.

Title: The Secret to Running EF Core 2.0 Migrations from a NET Core or NET Standard Class Library
Description: With EF6 it was possible to use migrations from a class library with no exe project in sight. EF Core migrations can run from a .NET Framework or .NET Core project but not .NET Standard. It needs a runtime.

Title: Fundamentals: Entity Framework
Description: Microsoft's Entity Framework (EF) is a powerful Object-Relational Mapper (ORM) that boosts developer productivity by automating much of the work associated with designing and interfacing with an application database.

Title: Add a Primary and Foreign Key Relationship with Code First approach in Entity Framework
Description: This article will demonstrate how to implement primary key and foreign key relationship in Code First approach in Entity Framework.

Title: Tutorial: Using Entity Framework Core as an In-Memory Database for ASP.NET Core
Description: One of the most exciting features in the new version of Entity Framework (Entity Framework Core 1.0) is the addition of an in-memory data provider. This makes it possible to prototype applications and write tests without having to set up a local or external database.

Title: Getting started with Entity Framework 7
Description: I am sure that most of you have heard about the new version of the Microsoft .NET framework.  Version 5 of .NET is a huge leap forward for many reasons, the most significant being completely open sourcing the core of .NET and first-class support for non-Windows environments such as OSX and Linux.

Title: ASP .NET 5 with Entity Framework 7
Description: Older versions of the Entity Framework need a full .NET runtime in order to work. If at some point you want to use the new .NET 5 Core e.g. to run your application on Linux etc., you should use Entity Framework 7.

Title: ASP .NET 5 Identity with Entity Framework 7 Setup
Description: In this article we will demonstrate how to provide authentication to ASP .NET 5 applications using ASP .NET Identity with Entity Framework 7.

Title: Entity Framework 7 Migrations and Source Control
Description: When I first came across migrations in Entity Framework 6 I thought it was a fantastic way to track data model changes in a project.  This thought lasted until my team started to share and sync these migrations through source control.

Title: Moving your Entity Framework 7 models to an external project
Description: I like to keep my Entity Framework data context and models in a separate project from my main ASP.NET application, so I can easily share it amongst other projects in the solution.

Title: Entity Framework 7 Code First Migrations
Description: This post is about Entity Framework 7 Code First Migrations. Code First Migrations is a Entity Framework feature which helps to apply database schema changes without re-creating the whole database.

Title: Exploring Entity Framework Core 1.0
Description: It's been an exciting world working with the latest Microsoft .NET technologies. First, .NET Core 1.0 was officially released, a lightweight multi-platform programming framework that has shown to be versatile for deployment.

Title: Getting Started With Entity Framework
Description: In this post and on the following I'm going to write about the ADO.NET Entity Framework. To those who wait for the design pattern posts, I'm going to continue writing about design patterns as well.

Title: Entity Data Model (EDM) In Entity Framework
Description: In the last post about entity framework I wrote an introduction about the framework. Today I'm going to dive into the heart of the framework, i.e. the entity data model (EDM).

Title: Schema Definitions Of EDM In Entity Framework
Description: In this post, I'm going to explain a little about the bits and bites of the new XML schema types which describe the models.

Title: Entity Data Model Designer
Description: In my previous posts I explained how to get started with the entity framework. In this post, I'm going to explain how to use the entity data model designer.

Title: How And Why To Use DefiningQuery Element
Description: In this post, I'm going to show how to do things that the designer isn't able to perform (for the ADO.NET's team notice). You should be familiar with the EDM XML schema types and the general elements before you start to read this post.

Title: ToTraceString Method in Entity Framework
Description: In this post I'm going to introduce the ToTraceString method which enables us to view the generated T-SQL statement of a specific query we execute in Entity Framework.

Title: Disabling Change Tracking in Entity Framework
Description: Entity Framework came along with a very helpful change tracking system. But with great power comes great responsibility. The responsibility of the developers is to make sure that the change tracking option will not be responsible to bad performance.

Title: Entity Splitting in Entity Framework
Description: One of the mapping scenarios that I talked about in the session at WDC this week but I didn't show an example is entity splitting in Entity Framework. This post will explain what is entity splitting and how to implement this mapping scenario in Entity Framework.

Title: Mapping Stored Procedures to ObjectContext Methods
Description: In this post, I'll show a simple scenario of how to map stored procedures to ObjectContext methods in Entity Framework.

Title: Adding Many to Many Relationship between Entities
Description: A friend of mine asked me this week a question regarding link tables in Entity Framework. In their system they have a link table of many to many relationship between more then two tables.

Title: QueryView Element in Entity Framework
Description: In a very old post that I wrote I explained what is the DefiningQuery element and how to use it. In this post I'm going to explain what is the QueryView element, how to use it and the difference between using a DefiningQuery and using a QueryView.

Title: Mapping Stored Procedure Results to a Custom Entity in Entity Framework
Description: In the post I'm going to explain how to map results of a stored procedure to a custom created entity which we have created with the Entity Framework designer.

Title: Creating Complex Types in Entity Framework
Description: The following post will explain what are complex types in Entity Framework and how to use them.

Title: Supporting Stored Procedures that Return Primitive Types in Entity Framework
Description: One drawback of Entity Framework designer is that it does not generate code in the object context for function imports of stored procedures that return a primitive type. This post will explain how to achieve this functionality up until the designer will support it in the next release of Entity Framework.

Title: Table Splitting in Entity Framework
Description: Entity Framework include a lot of ways to customize the Entity Data Model. One such way is Table Splitting which enables to map multiple entity types to a single table. This post will show how we can achieve this ability.

Title: Calling User-Defined Functions (UDFs) in Entity Framework
Description: In this post I'm going to show you how to Call User-Defined Functions (UDFs) in Entity Framework

Title: Defining Custom Functions in Entity Framework
Description: In this post, I'm going to show you how to define a custom function in EF.

Title: Using Repository Pattern with Entity Framework
Description: In the post I'll show how you can use the Repository Pattern in order to make an abstraction layer on top of Entity Framework.

Title: Entity Framework Inheritance Types
Description: In this post, I'm going to explain the main three inheritance ways that you can use with EF. These ways are supported in other ORMs as well.

Title: Table Per Type Inheritance in Entity Framework
Description: The first inheritanceTable Per Type Inheritance in Entity Framework mapping I'm going to show is called Table Per Type or TPT.

Title: Table Per Hierarchy Inheritance in Entity Framework
Description: In the second inheritance mappings tutorials I'm going to write about the Table Per Hierarchy (TPH) inheritance mapping.

Title: Table Per Concrete Type Inheritance in Entity Framework
Description: The last inheritance mapping that I'm going to write about is the Table Per Concrete Type inheritance (TPC). This inheritance type is very rare but you should be aware of how to create it when it is needed.

Title: CompiledQuery in Entity Framework
Description: If we want to reduce the cost of executing a query in Entity Framework we can use a CompiledQuery to the rescue.

Title: Using Conditional Mapping in Entity Framework
Description: There are times that we want to retrieve only a portion of data from a table in the database permanently by some filter.

Title: Revisiting the Repository and Unit of Work Patterns with Entity Framework
Description: In this post, I'll show you a better and less naive solution for imposing the Unit of Work and the Repository patterns with Entity Framework.

Title: Eager Loading with Repository Pattern and Entity Framework
Description: In this post, I'll show you how to include the eager loading ability of Entity Framework.

Title: POCO and Entity Framework
Description: I have been playing around with Entity Framework 4 and was intrigued by the POCO support in it, as the new version is CTP 4.0 and we might be approaching the RTM version soon so I thought i will collate my experiences and gotchas on how to use them.

Title: POCO and Entity Framework:Using Complex Types
Description: I will update my code from the previous post with CTP 5 changes and will introduce some real life project scenarios as well.

Title: EF Code First: Managing relationships
Description: In this post I will show how easy it is to manage relationships between entities using the EF Code first approach. I think this is one of the reasons I really like EF Code first as it makes things so simple and easy.

Title: EF Code First: Table Per Hierarchy
Description: In this post, I am going to show you how to use Table Per Hierarchy relationship with Code First Approach.

Title: EF Code First: Table Per Type
Description: In this post I am going to show you another type of mapping inheritance relationship which is called Table Per Type and it is quite similar to the Table Per hierarchy from the last post.

Title: EF Code First:Tips & Tricks
Description: In this post I am going to show you some small tips & tricks about EF Code First which are quite useful.

Title: EF Code First: Many to Many Self referencing relationship
Description: In this post I am going to show you how to map a self referencing many to many relationships as it's a very interesting scenario.

Title: EF Code First:Running SQL scripts
Description: In this post I am going to show you how to run SQL scripts in Entity Framework 4.1 as we have seen that it's quite easy to define our database entities using the DBSet and all the relationship using the EntityTypeConfiguration class.

Title: EF Code First:Executing Stored Procedure
Description: In this post I am going to show you how to use stored procedure with Entity Framework 4.1 even though it is official that Entity Framework 4.1 doesn't support stored procedure and this was announced by the ADO.NET team at the time of the release.

Title: Entity Framework: Viewing SQL
Description: In this post I am going to show you a cool trick I learned regarding ObjectQuery class and how it can be useful when working with Entity Framework.

Title: Getting Started with Entity Framework 5
Description: I finally took the plunge and installed Visual Studio 2012 and Entity Framework 5.Before I delve into any EF 5 code a few things I want to clarify about it.

Title: Entity Framework 7: In Memory Testing
Description: I am really excited about the in-memory testing feature of Entity Framework 7 as testing in the previous versions of Entity Framework wasn't straightforward and painful at times.

Title: Entity Splitting in Entity Framework
Description: I have done a lot of post on Entity Framework Code First which includes some simple tips and tricks to more complex scenarios of mapping relationship and here are some of those post if you want to read them.

Title: Table Splitting in Entity Framework
Description: In my previous post I covered the Entity Splitting technique and in this post I am going to talk about just the opposite of that technique.
